00038 import unittest 
00039 from pcs.packets import ipv4
00040 from pcs.packets import tcp
00041 from pcs.packets import ethernet
00042 import tcptest
00043 import pcs
00044 import pdb
00045 import time
00046 
00047 class TestResetFromClosedState(unittest.TestCase):
00048     """
00049        RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00050        Page 36 - Reset Generation  
00051 
00052        As a general rule, reset (RST) must be sent whenever a segment arrives
00053        which apparently is not intended for the current connection.  A reset
00054        must not be sent if it is not clear that this is the case.
00055 
00056        [PREPARATION]
00057        ==at DEVICE UNDER TEST(DUT)
00058          inetd with descard server running (port 9)
00059          you must have access DUT's shell with kill -TERM inetd process and /etc/rc.d/inetd stop privileges 
00060 
00061     """
00062 
00063     def setUp(self):
00064         """
00065         """
00066         import random
00067         
00068         #constants
00069         self.thisside = 0
00070         self.thatside = 1
00071 
00072         self.tcb = tcptest.tcb()
00073         
00074         self.tcb.ip = { self.thisside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.210") , \
00075                     self.thatside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.220")}
00076         
00077 
00078         self.tcb.ipid = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1, (1<<16)-1) , \
00079                       self.thatside : 0}
00080 
00081 
00082         self.tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00083                          self.thatside : 9}
00084 
00085         self.tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00086                              self.thatside : 0}
00087         
00088         
00089         self.tcb.ether = \
00090                 { self.thisside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:9d:57:c9") , \
00091                   self.thatside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:db:c5:22") }
00092 
00093 
00094         self.tcb.output = { self.thisside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") , \
00095                         self.thatside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") } 
00096         
00097     def testResetFromClosedStateSYNwithACK(self):
00098         """
00099         RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00100         Page 36
00101 
00102         1.  If the connection does not exist (CLOSED) then a reset is sent
00103         in response to any incoming segment except another reset.  In
00104         particular, SYNs addressed to a non-existent connection are rejected
00105         by this means.
00106 
00107         If the incoming segment has an ACK field, the reset takes its
00108         sequence number from the ACK field of the segment, otherwise the
00109         reset has sequence number zero and the ACK field is set to the sum
00110         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment.
00111         The connection remains in the CLOSED state.
00112         
00113         Procedure:
00114         (1)establish a connection
00115         (2)the DUT make a active close
00116         (3)we wait for a couple of MSL (enough time to connection go to closed-state)
00117         (4)send a SYN with ACK of the above connection
00118         (5)waits for a RESET with sequence equals to ack sent 
00119         """
00120 
00121         #(1)establish a connection
00122         tcptest.threewayhandshakenoopt(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00123 
00124         #(2)the DUT make a active close
00125         print "################"
00126         print "# IMPORTANT NOTE"
00127         print "################"
00128         print "#"
00129         print "# At this moment you shoud do the following in the device under test(DUT):"
00130         print '# > socket -4 | grep "\:9"'
00131         print "# > kill -TERM <PID_OF_INETD>"
00132         print "# > /etc/rc.d/inetd stop"
00133         print "# "
00134         tcptest.passivecloseconnection(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00135 
00136         #(3)we wait for a couple of MSL (enough time to connection go to closed-state)
00137         print "# "
00138         print "# Waiting for a couple of MSL(Maximun Segment Lifetime)"
00139         time.sleep(60) #2MSL(freebsd7)
00140 
00141         #(4)send a SYN with ACK of the above connection
00142         # 
00143         #--->Sending SYN
00144         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = tcptest.createsyn(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00145         #createsyn sets ack bit to 0 
00146         tcpsyn.ack = 1
00147         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00148 
00149         #(5)waits for a RESET with sequence equals to ack sent
00150         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self,self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00151         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcpsyn)
00152 
00153     
00154     def testResetFromNonExistentConnectionSYN(self):
00155         """
00156         RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00157         Page 36
00158 
00159         1.  If the connection does not exist (CLOSED) then a reset is sent
00160         in response to any incoming segment except another reset.  In
00161         particular, SYNs addressed to a non-existent connection are rejected
00162         by this means.
00163 
00164         If the incoming segment has an ACK field, the reset takes its
00165         sequence number from the ACK field of the segment, otherwise the
00166         reset has sequence number zero and the ACK field is set to the sum 
00167         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment.
00168         The connection remains in the CLOSED state.
00169 
00170         Procedure:
00171         (1)reset our tcb sequence and sport records.
00172         (2)send a SYN withOUT ACK(ack bit=0, ack_number=0) 
00173         (3)waits for a RESET with sequence equals to zero and ACK field is set to the sum
00174         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment
00175         """
00176         self.tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00177             self.thatside : 9}
00178         self.tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00179             self.thatside : 0}
00180 
00181         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = tcptest.createsyn(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00182         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00183         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self,self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00184         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcpsyn)
00185 
00186 
00187     def testResetFromNonExistentConnectionFIN(self):
00188         """
00189         RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00190         Page 36
00191 
00192         1.  If the connection does not exist (CLOSED) then a reset is sent
00193         in response to any incoming segment except another reset.  In
00194         particular, SYNs addressed to a non-existent connection are rejected
00195         by this means.
00196 
00197         If the incoming segment has an ACK field, the reset takes its
00198         sequence number from the ACK field of the segment, otherwise the
00199         reset has sequence number zero and the ACK field is set to the sum 
00200         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment.
00201         The connection remains in the CLOSED state.
00202 
00203         Procedure:
00204         (1)reset our tcb sequence and sport records.
00205         (2)send a ACK withOUT ACK(ack bit=0, ack_number=0) 
00206         (3)waits for a RESET with sequence equals to zero and ACK field is set to the sum
00207         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment
00208         """
00209         self.tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00210             self.thatside : 9}
00211         self.tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00212             self.thatside : 0}
00213 
00214         (ipfin, tcpfin) = tcptest.createfin(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00215         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipfin, tcpfin, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00216         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self,self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00217         tcptest.assertReset(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, self.thisside, self.thatside, tcpfin)
00218 
00219 
00220     def testResetFromNonExistentConnectionRST(self):
00221         """
00222         RFC 793 - Section 3.4 Establishing a Connection
00223         Page 36
00224 
00225         1.  If the connection does not exist (CLOSED) then a reset is sent
00226         in response to any incoming segment except another reset.  In
00227         particular, SYNs addressed to a non-existent connection are rejected
00228         by this means.
00229 
00230         If the incoming segment has an ACK field, the reset takes its
00231         sequence number from the ACK field of the segment, otherwise the
00232         reset has sequence number zero and the ACK field is set to the sum 
00233         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment.
00234         The connection remains in the CLOSED state.
00235 
00236         Procedure:
00237         (1)reset our tcb sequence and sport records.
00238         (2)send a ACK withOUT ACK(ack bit=0, ack_number=0) 
00239         (3)waits for a RESET with sequence equals to zero and ACK field is set to the sum
00240         of the sequence number and segment length of the incoming segment
00241         """
00242         self.tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00243             self.thatside : 9}
00244         self.tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00245             self.thatside : 0}
00246 
00247         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = tcptest.createfakerstfromtcb(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)   
00248         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00249         
00250         #TODO:We need wait 2MSL to be sure the receiver didn't answer 
00251         #TODO:We need a socket method to listen for up to certain seconds.
00252         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self,self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
